title: Facebook chief marketing officer to depart in September
text: Facebook Inc. FB, -0.74% shares were flat in after-hours trading Friday following the company's announcement that its chief marketing officer, Antonio Lucio, is leaving Sept.

title: Facebook reportedly eyes shutting off political ads after US election
text: Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg and other company executives have been discussing a “kill switch” to shut off political advertising after the election is over to curb misinformation, the New York Times reported Friday, citing unnamed sources. Facebook is looking at post-election scenarios that include attempts by President Trump or his campaign to use the.

title: Mark Zuckerberg testifies in FTC's antitrust probe
text: Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley reports on Mark Zuckerberg being interviewed by FTC as part of antitrust probe into Facebook's business practices.

title: Facebook is preparing steps against false election claims: The New York Times' Mike Isaac
text: The New York Times tech reporter Mike Isaac joins CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team to discuss how Facebook is preparing steps against false election claims.

title: Facebook denounces hate, bigotry, its India chief says amid content row
text: Facebook is a non-partisan platform which denounces hate and bigotry, the company's India head said on Friday, amid a controversy over how the U.S. social media giant regulates political content in its biggest market by number of users.

title: Facebook Braces Itself for Trump to Cast Doubt on Election Results
text: The world’s biggest social network is working out what steps to take should President Trump use its platform to dispute the vote.

title: Big Tech Growth Surges Despite Government Scrutiny
text: Even during a pandemic, with the economy contracting over 30 %, the four companies reported $773 billion combined revenue annualized to date.

title: Have $2,000? These 2 Stocks Are Poised for Growth During the Coronavirus Era and Beyond
text: These companies have products and services hundreds of millions of people want, whether they're stuck at home or not.

title: FTC grills Mark Zuckerberg in Facebook antitrust probe
text: The Federal Trade Commission questioned Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg this week as part of its antitrust investigation into the social-media titan, reports say. Zuckerberg testified remotely over two days during an FTC investigative hearing, Politico reported Thursday.

title: Facebook and Twitter are trying to crack down on QAnon — but it may be too late
text: For three years, QAnon spread from the dark edges of the internet to mainstream social networks, and the social networks did little to stop it happening. Now Facebook and Twitter are trying to crack down — but it may be too late. What was once a fringe conspiracy theory has now been openly endorsed by some congressional candidates with a real shot of winning, and complimented by the President of the United States.

title: A Viral Market Update XIII: The Strong (FANGAM) Get Stronger
text: It is true that US equities did well over the decade, but the FANGAM stocks rose much more, rising from 6.5% of the overall market capitalization of all US equities, in January 2010, to close to 15% in January 2020.

title: Facebook trails expanding portability tools ahead of FTC hearing
text: Facebook is considering expanding the types of data its users are able to port directly to alternative platforms. In comments on portability sent to US regulators ahead of an FTC hearing on the topic next month, Facebook says it intends to expand the scope of its data portability offerings “in the coming months”.

title: Got $300? These 3 Stocks Are No-Brainer Buys
text: You don't need to begin with a fortune to make one on Wall Street.

title: India parliamentary panel to question Facebook on content controversy
text: An Indian parliamentary committee will question Facebook executives on how the social media giant regulates political content in the country, a panel member told Reuters on Friday, following controversy about its practices.

title: Facebook pushes for data portability legislation ahead of FTC hearing
text: Facebook Inc on Friday pushed for legislation that makes it easier for users to transfer photos and videos to a rival tech platform, in comments it sent to the Federal Trade Commission ahead of a hearing on the topic on Sept. 22.
